reviewText:
I got this to have that cliche game to play with the Wife.

This is a hidden object game with a few mini-games between each round of hidden objects rooms.

Not bad for what it is, but I wish these kinds of games had more mini-games and more complex puzzles.

reviewText: Another neat hidden object game from PopCap.

reviewText: Sadly, this is a rather mediocre hidden object game that was developed by SpinTop" rather than PopCap (who only published it) - wish I'd noticed that before purchasing as PopCap themselves make excellent games.\n\nThere is a simple story-framing piece of text at the start
date: then it's the same New York-themed screens (with like 10 objects to find in each) over and over and over
recommended: with each grouping of 2-8 (of the 25) screens separated by simple match 3
votesFunny: where you have story setups for every screen you play).  Got about 12 "clues" (levels
commentsCount: out of 25) in before giving up in boredom
column16: so I don't know if they bothered with anything other than a simple text outro once you find the will...\n\nIn short
column17: not worth the effort or the price - and *always* check to make sure PopCap's the developer as well as the publisher before buying. :/\n\nEDIT: Oh
column19: if you leave your mouse on an object while you're searching for others (to remind yourself where it is so you can get multiple in a row for a speed bonus)
column20: it will pop up a big panel
column21: that you have to click away
column22: once per scene telling you that you can use the hint button (no matter how many times you may have used that button in the past).  So incredibly annoying."
column26: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Another Mystery P.I. Game, another about 10 hours I dumped into a game of persistence and patience.\n\nAs with the Mystery P.I. games I finished before, The Lottery Ticket" and "Lost in Los Angeles"
date: the principle is this: you have a huge picture
recommended: and you'll have to find objects
hoursPlayed: which often are camouflaged in color and shape. Whether you play with or without time limit is pretty much irrelevant. If you have played Hidden Object games before
voteText:
you'll be fast to find everything.

The story of an eccentric New York billionaire having hidden his fortune somewhere in NY City is a flavor to the game. It is not a very... gripping story. It pretty much gets glossed over. But it's nice.

Not recommended unless it's massively reduced or purchased in a bundle.

One Mystery P.I. game from the Popcap bundle remaining for me. But I will play and review. I must be insane.

PS: At least 2 hours are due to having the game running in the background."

reviewText: I liked it. Nicer puzzles than most similar titles and they stick to the themes. It's abotuthe puzzles not the plots.
